text:
Hi,

Tried to SVGize these fonts : http://www.yare.org/egypt/files/gardiner.zip

... without success.

It looks like that CmapFormat4 generates a "wrong" startCode[] array that can't
be exploited in SVGFont.writeFontAsSVGFragment() because :

int glyphIndex = cmapFmt.mapCharCode(i);

... is always set to 0.

This is due to the following statement in CmapFormat4.mapCharCode:

if (startCode[i] <= charCode) {

... which is always false.

Is it a problem with the font or with Batik itself ?

Cheers,

p.b.
creator: pierrick.brihaye@free.fr

text:
Hi,

I think I've got it : the characters range from 61472 to 61689.

Instead of considering the implicit 32 to 127 (ASCII) range, would it be
possible to consider a smarter "default" range : 

lowest(startCode[0-(segCount-1)] to highest(endCode[0-(segCount-1)] ???

On a related topic, a testcard in this latter range would also be smarter than a
testcard in the 32 to 127 range IMHO.

If such a solution is considered, it would be nice to append a space between the
different glyhs of the testcard in order to prevent potential ligatures, arabic
ones for example.

I you like, I have many other suggestions on SVG fonts generation :-)

Cheers,

p.b.

text:
Well I'm happy to accept patches.  
The test card generator already allows you to specify the start
and end of the range.  Part of the idea of the default test card is
to show glyphs that the font doesn't support.

Probably the best thing might be to add a 'default range'
option that would use the min/max glyph in font to set the 
low and high range.

creator: pierrick.brihaye@free.fr
